snippet: The long-awaited measure would cut mandatory prison sentences for nonviolent offenders and promote more early release from federal prisons.

byline.original: By CARL HULSE and JENNIFER STEINHAUER

abstract: Bipartisan group of senators announce broad criminal justice reform measure, which they describe as historic federal justice overhaul and example of way compromise can lead to effective governance; legislation would reduce mandatory prison sentences for nonviolent offenders and institute programs to educate prisoners, among other measures.
lead_paragraph: The long-awaited measure would cut mandatory prison sentences for nonviolent offenders and promote more early release from federal prisons.

headline.print_headline: Sentencing Overhaul Proposed in Senate With Bipartisan Backing
headline.main: Sentencing Overhaul Proposed in Senate With Bipartisan Backing
